brainly_data.question: Identify the playwright--Aeschylus, Sophocles, Euripides, or Aristophanes--described in the following statement. 4. (1 pt) Only seven of his plays survive, and many people consider his Oedipus Rex the greatest Greek tragedy. A. Aeschylus B. Sophocles C. Euripides D. Aristophanes
brainly_data.subject: History

all_answers.question: Identify the playwright--Aeschylus, Sophocles, Euripides, or Aristophanes--described in the following statement. 4. (1 pt) Only seven of his plays survive, and many people consider his Oedipus Rex the greatest Greek tragedy. A. Aeschylus B. Sophocles C. Euripides D. Aristophanes
all_answers.subject: History
all_answers.text: The correct answer is Sophocles. He wrote Oedipus Rex and is considered by many to be the greatest writer of tragedies ever, having written not only Oedipus Rex, but also Antigone.

top_answer.subject: History
top_answer.text: The correct answer is Sophocles. He wrote Oedipus Rex and is considered by many to be the greatest writer of tragedies ever, having written not only Oedipus Rex, but also Antigone.
